definition: to take a wrong turn/to go wrong
lit. settling accounts after the autumn harvest (idiom); to wait until the time is ripe to settle accounts/to bide time for revenge
to take the blame/to be a scapegoat/to carry the can
variant of 內訌|内讧[nei4 hong4]
to urge reconciliation/to dissuade from punitive action

Wuchang Uprising of October 10th, 1911, which led to Sun Yat-sen's Xinhai Revolution and the fall of the Qing dynasty
to move a stone and stub one's toe/to shoot oneself in the foot (idiom)

definition: stir up the fire and you get burnt (idiom); to get one's fingers burnt/fig. to suffer on account of one's own meddling
real face fully revealed (idiom); fig. to unmask and expose the whole truth
shameful/scandalous/to be humiliated/to make a fool of sb or oneself/to make sb lose face
